DisplayedItem.name: DI_39652
DisplayedItem.title: For multiple tumors of the same cellular lineage (e.g., multifocal papillary carcinoma, follicular carcinoma, etc.), one may choose to repeat the following 10 elements (Tumor Site, Histologic Tumor Types and Subtypes, Tumor Size, Tumor Proliferative Activity, Tumor Necrosis, Angioinvasion, Lymphatic Invasion, Perineural Invasion, Extrathyroidal Extension, and Margin Status) for clinically relevant tumors. For medullary thyroid carcinoma, please use a separate synoptic report.

Question.title: ?Tumor Identifier (required only for cases with multiple tumors)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_847126
DisplayedItem.title: All papillary microcarcinomas (less than or equal to 1 cm) should be subtyped based on the 5th edition of the WHO classification of thyroid tumors. Papillary microcarcinoma does not stand alone as a subtype and should not be used alone without a subtype designation.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_847173
DisplayedItem.title: The Ki-67 proliferation index reporting is required in all medullary thyroid carcinomas as well as in the medullary thyroid carcinoma component of mixed medullary and follicular cell-derived thyroid carcinomas. The Ki-67 proliferation assessment should follow the IARC / WHO guidelines. Visual estimation based on routine microscopic examination (also known as eyeballing) is not allowed.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_846618
DisplayedItem.title: # Historically, less than 4 vessels have been considered as focal and involvement of 4 or more vessels has been referred to extensive angioinvasion in follicular cell-derived thyroid carciniomas. However, the 5th edition of the WHO classification questioned the validity of the cut-off point applied for this distinction. For this reason, pathologists are encouraged to document the extent of angioinvasion based on the number of vessels involved.

ListItem.name: LI_39005
ListItem.title: Present, microscopic strap muscle invasion only, with no clinical / macroscopic evidence of invasion

ListItem.name: LI_43442
ListItem.title: Present, clinical / macroscopic AND histologically confirmed

ListItem.name: LI_38025
ListItem.title: Invading subcutaneous soft tissues, larynx, trachea, esophagus or recurrent laryngeal nerve (i.e., pT4a)

ListItem.name: LI_38026
ListItem.title: Invading prevertebral fascia or encasing the carotid artery or mediastinal vessels (i.e., pT4b)

ListItem.name: LI_847059
ListItem.title: Margins involved by the tumor, no microscopic extrathyroidal extension (strap muscle invasion) is noted in the sections examined, and no clinical (intraoperative and / or radiologic) or macroscopic evidence of extrathyroidal extension

ListItem.name: LI_847060
ListItem.title: Margins involved by the tumor, no macroscopic / microscopic extrathyroidal extension (strap muscle) is noted in the sections examined, and clinical (intraoperative and / or radiologic) evidence of extrathyroidal extension (specify)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_847060_1
Property.val: Margins involved by the tumor, no macroscopic / microscopic extrathyroidal extension (strap muscle) is noted in the sections examined, and clinical (intraoperative and / or radiologic) evidence of extrathyroidal extension

ListItem.name: LI_847061
ListItem.title: Margins involved by the tumor, no macroscopic / microscopic extrathyroidal extension (strap muscle invasion) is noted in the sections examined, and no documented data available for intraoperative and / or radiologic evidence of extrathyroidal extension

DisplayedItem.name: DI_47709
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_47709_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_847064
DisplayedItem.title: # Salivary gland-type carcinomas, thymic tumors within the thyroid and thyroid carcinomas of uncertain cytogenesis may be staged using this scheme, recognizing lack of validation for such neoplasms. Low-risk follicular cell-derived thyroid neoplasms are not required to be staged.

ListItem.name: LI_847063
ListItem.title: For malignant follicular cell-derived thyroid neoplasms including follicular thyroid carcinoma, invasive follicular variant papillary thyroid carcinoma, papillary thyroid carcinoma, oncocytic carcinoma of the thyroid, high-grade differentiated thyroid carcinomas, poorly differentiated thyroid carcinoma and anaplastic follicular cell-derived thyroid carcinoma#

DisplayedItem.name: DI_9144
DisplayedItem.title: There is no category of carcinoma in situ (pTis) relative to carcinomas of thyroid gland.

ListItem.name: LI_327751
ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_9140
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_47301
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Tumor size less than or equal to 2 cm in greatest dimension, limited to thyroid

ListItem.name: LI_24298
ListItem.title: pT1a: Tumor less than or equal to 1 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the thyroid.

ListItem.name: LI_24299
ListItem.title: pT1b: Tumor greater than 1 cm but less than or equal to 2 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the thyroid

ListItem.name: LI_9142
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor greater than 2 cm but less than or equal to 4 cm in greatest dimension, limited to thyroid

DisplayedItem.name: DI_43923
DisplayedItem.title: pT3: Tumor greater than 4 cm limited to the thyroid, or gross extrathyroidal extension invading only strap muscles

ListItem.name: LI_38035
ListItem.title: pT3a: Tumor greater than 4 cm limited to the thyroid

ListItem.name: LI_38036
ListItem.title: pT3b: Gross extrathyroidal extension invading only strap muscles (sternohyoid, sternothyroid, thyrohyoid, or omohyoid muscles) from a tumor of any size

DisplayedItem.name: DI_37460
DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Includes gross extrathyroidal extension beyond the strap muscles

ListItem.name: LI_38038
ListItem.title: pT4a: Gross extrathyroidal extension invading subcutaneous soft tissues, larynx, trachea, esophagus, or recurrent laryngeal nerve from a tumor of any size

ListItem.name: LI_38039
ListItem.title: pT4b: Gross extrathyroidal extension invading prevertebral fascia or encasing the carotid artery or mediastinal vessels from a tumor of any size

ListItem.title: (m) multiple primary synchronous tumors in a single organ

ListItem.title: pT not assigned (cannot be determined based on available pathological information)

ListItem.name: LI_58666
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39856
DisplayedItem.title: pT1: Tumor size less than or equal to 2 cm in greatest dimension, limited to thyroid

ListItem.name: LI_59245
ListItem.title: pT1a: Tumor less than or equal to 1 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the thyroid.

ListItem.name: LI_54553
ListItem.title: pT1b: Tumor greater than 1 cm but less than or equal to 2 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the thyroid

ListItem.name: LI_56717
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor greater than 2 cm but less than or equal to 4 cm in greatest dimension, limited to thyroid

DisplayedItem.name: DI_50415
DisplayedItem.title: pT3: Tumor greater than 4 cm or with extrathyroidal extension

ListItem.name: LI_39236
ListItem.title: pT3a: Tumor greater than 4 cm in greatest dimension limited to the thyroid

ListItem.name: LI_40381
ListItem.title: pT3b: Tumor of any size with gross extrathyroidal extension invading only strap muscles (sternohyoid, sternothyroid, thyrohyoid or omohyoid muscles)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_50570
DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Advanced disease

ListItem.name: LI_51244
ListItem.title: pT4a: Moderately advanced disease; tumor of any size with gross extrathyroidal extension into the nearby tissues of the neck, including subcutaneous soft tissue, larynx, trachea, esophagus, or recurrent laryngeal nerve

ListItem.name: LI_47778
ListItem.title: pT4b: Very advanced disease; tumor of any size with extension toward the spine or into nearby large blood vessels, gross extrathyroidal extension invading the prevertebral fascia, or encasing the carotid artery or mediastinal vessels

ListItem.name: LI_847074
ListItem.title: (m) multiple primary synchronous tumors in a single organ

DisplayedItem.title: pN0: No evidence of locoregional lymph node metastasis

DisplayedItem.name: DI_52579
DisplayedItem.title: pN1: Metastasis to regional nodes

ListItem.name: LI_38046
ListItem.title: pN1a: Metastasis to level VI or VII (pretracheal, paratracheal, or prelaryngeal / Delphian, or upper mediastinal) lymph nodes. This can be unilateral or bilateral disease.

ListItem.name: LI_38047
ListItem.title: pN1b: Metastasis to unilateral, bilateral, or contralateral lateral neck lymph nodes (levels I, II, III, IV, or V) or retropharyngeal lymph nodes

DisplayedItem.name: DI_34483
DisplayedItem.title: For reporting molecular testing and other cancer biomarker testing results, the CAP Thyroid Biomarker Template should be used. Pending biomarker studies should be listed in the Comments section of this report.
